rpSBML’s Documentation¶

Indices and tables¶

  • Index

  • Module Index

  • Search Page

Introduction¶

Welcome to the documentation of rpSBML, a metabolic engeinnering extension of libSBML project to handle heterologous metabolic pathways. The project was created as a means of converting the results of RetroPath2.0 to SBML files for easier handling and interoperability.

Usage¶

Basic usage include opening a rpSBML file, extracting some of its information:

Note

You can open any SBML file using rpSBML and manipulate it to enrich it. The example provided here only shows the addition of the

To open a SBML file:

rpsbml = rpSBML.rpSBML('rp_1_1', path='/path/to/your/file_rpsbml.xml')

To extract all the information of a pathway in the form of a dictionnary you can use:

json_friendly_pathway = rpsbml.genJSON()

To extract the species that are qualified as being central you can use:

groups = rpsbml.model.getPlugin('groups')
central_species_group = groups.getGroup('central_species')
central_species = [member.getIdRef() for member in central_species_group.getListOfMembers()]

API¶

class rpSBML.rpSBML(modelName, document=None, path=None)¶

Bases: object

This class uses the libSBML object and handles it by adding BRSynth annotation

addUpdateBRSynth(sbase_obj, annot_header, value, units=None, isAlone=False, isList=False, isSort=True, meta_id=None)¶

Append or update an entry to the BRSynth annotation of the passed libsbml.SBase object.

If the annot_header isn’t contained in the annotation it is created. If it already exists it overwrites it

Parameters

  • sbase_obj (libsbml.SBase) – The libSBML object to add the different

  • annot_header (str) – The annotation header that defines the type of entry

  • value (Union[str, int, float, list]) – The value(s) to add

  • units (str) – Add a values unit to the entry

  • isAlone (bool) – Add the entry without any units or defined within a value child (Setting this to True will ignore any units)

  • isList (bool) – Define if the value entry is a list or not

  • isSort (bool) – Sort the list that is passed (Only if the isList is True)

  • meta_id (str) – The meta ID to be added to the annotation string

Return type

bool

Returns

Sucess or failure of the function

addUpdateMIRIAM(sbase_obj, type_param, xref, meta_id=None)¶

Append or update an entry to the MIRIAM annotation of the passed libsbml.SBase object.

If the annot_header isn’t contained in the annotation it is created. If it already exists it overwrites it

Parameters

  • sbase_obj – libsbml.SBase, The libSBML object to add the different

  • type_param (str) – The type of parameter entered. Valid include [‘compartment’, ‘reaction’, ‘species’]

  • xref (dict) – Dictionnary of the cross reference

  • meta_id (str) – The meta ID to be added to the annotation string

Return type

bool

Returns

Sucess or failure of the function

compareBRSYNTHAnnotations(source_annot, target_annot)¶

Determine if two libsbml species or reactions have members in common in BRSynth annotation

Compare two dictionnaries and if any of the values of any of the same keys are the same then the function return True, and if none are found then return False

Parameters

  • source_annot – libsbml.Reaction, Source object of libSBML

  • target_annot – libsbml.Reaction, Target object of libSBML

Return type

bool

Returns

True if there is at least one similar and False if none

compareMIRIAMAnnotations(source_annot, target_annot)¶

Determine if two libsbml species or reactions have members in common in MIRIAM annotation

Compare two dictionnaries and if any of the values of any of the same keys are the same then the function return True, and if none are found then return False

Parameters

  • source_annot – libsbml.Reaction, Source object of libSBML

  • target_annot – libsbml.Reaction, Target object of libSBML

Return type

bool

Returns

True if there is at least one similar and False if none

compareRPpathways(measured_sbml)¶

Function to compare two SBML’s RP pathways

Function that compares the annotations of reactions and if not found, the annotations of all species in that reaction to try to recover the correct ones. Because we are working with intermediate cofactors for the RP generated pathways, the annotation crossreference will not work. Best is to use the cross-reference to the original reaction

Parameters

measured_sbml (rpsbml) – rpSBML object

Return type

bool, dict

Returns

True if there is at least one similar and return the dict of similarities and False if none with empty dictionary

createFluxObj(fluxobj_id, reactionName, coefficient, isMax=True, meta_id=None)¶

Create libSBML flux objective

WARNING DEPRECATED – use the createMultiFluxObj() with lists of size one to define an objective function with a single reaction Using the FBC package one can add the FBA flux objective directly to the model. This function sets a particular reaction as objective with maximization or minimization objectives

Parameters

  • fluxobj_id (str) – The id of the flux objective

  • reactionName (str) – The id of the reaction that is associated with the reaction

  • coefficient (int) – The coefficient of the flux objective

  • isMax (bool) – Define if the objective is coefficient

  • meta_id (str) – Meta id (Default: None)

Return type

None

Returns

None

createMultiFluxObj(fluxobj_id, reactionNames, coefficients, isMax=True, meta_id=None)¶

Create libSBML flux objective

Using the FBC package one can add the FBA flux objective directly to the model. Can add multiple reactions. This function sets a particular reaction as objective with maximization or minimization objectives

Parameters

  • fluxobj_id (str) – The id of the flux objective

  • reactionNames (list) – The list of string id’s of the reaction that is associated with the reaction

  • coefficients (list) – The list of int defining the coefficients of the flux objective

  • isMax (bool) – Define if the objective is coefficient

  • meta_id (str) – Meta id (Default: None)

Return type

None

Returns

None

createPathway(pathway_id, meta_id=None)¶

Create libSBML pathway

Create a pathway that is added to self.model

Parameters

  • pathway_id (str) – The Groups id of the pathway id (Default: None)

  • meta_id (str) – Meta id (Default: None)

Return type

None

Returns

None

createReaction(reac_id, fluxUpperBound, fluxLowerBound, step, compartment_id, reaction_smiles=None, reacXref={}, pathway_id=None, meta_id=None)¶

Create libSBML reaction

Create a reaction that is added to the self.model in the input compartment id. fluxBounds is a list of libSBML.UnitDefinition, length of exactly 2 with the first position that is the upper bound and the second is the lower bound. reactants_dict and reactants_dict are dictionnaries that hold the following parameters: name, compartment, stoichiometry

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of the reaction

  • fluxUpperBound (float) – The reaction fbc upper bound

  • fluxLowerBound (float) – The reaction fbc lower bound

  • step (dict) – The id’s of the reactant and products of the reactions. Example: {‘left’: [], ‘right’: []}

  • compartment_id (str) – The id of the compartment to add the reaction

  • reaction_smiles (str) – The reaction rule to add to the BRSynth annotation of the reaction (Default: None)

  • reacXref (dict) – The dict containing the MIRIAM annotation (Default: {})

  • pathway_id (str) – The Groups id of the reaction to which the reacion id will be added (Default: None)

  • meta_id (str) – Meta id (Default: None)

Return type

None

Returns

None

createReturnFluxParameter(value, unit='mmol_per_gDW_per_hr', is_constant=True, parameter_id=None, meta_id=None)¶

Create libSBML flux parameters

Parameters are used for the bounds for FBA analysis. Unit parameter must be an instance of unitDefinition. If the parameter id exists, then the function returns the libsbml.Parameter object

Parameters

  • value (float) – Value set for the parameter

  • unit (str) – The unit id of the parameter

  • is_constant (bool) – Define if the parameter is constant

  • parameter_id (str) – Overwrite the default naming convention (Default: None)

  • meta_id (str) – Meta id (Default: None)

Return type

libsbml.Parameter

Returns

The newly created libsbml.Parameter

createSpecies(species_id, compartment_id, species_name=None, chemXref={}, inchi=None, inchikey=None, smiles=None, species_group_id=None, in_sink_group_id=None, meta_id=None)¶

Create libSBML species

Create a species that is added to self.model

Parameters

  • species_id (str) – The id of the created species

  • compartment_id (str) – The id of the compartment to add the reaction

  • species_name (str) – Overwrite the default name of the created species (Default: None)

  • chemXref (dict) – The dict containing the MIRIAM annotation (Default: {})

  • inchi (str) – The InChI string to be added to BRSynth annotation (Default: None)

  • inchikey (str) – The InChIkey string to be added to BRSynth annotation (Default: None)

  • smiles (str) – The SMLIES string to be added to BRSynth annotation (Default: None)

  • species_group_id (str) – The Groups id to add the species (Default: None)

  • in_sink_group_id (str) – The Groups id sink species to add the species (Default: None)

  • meta_id (str) – Meta id (Default: None)

Return type

None

Returns

None

findCreateObjective(reactions, coefficients, isMax=True, objective_id=None)¶

Find the objective (with only one reaction associated) based on the reaction ID and if not found create it

Parameters

  • reactions (list) – List of the reactions id’s to set as objectives

  • coefficients (list) – List of the coefficients about the objectives

  • isMax (bool) – Maximise or minimise the objective

  • objective_id (str) – overwite the default id if created (from obj_[reactions])

Raises

  • FileNotFoundError – If the file cannot be found

  • AttributeError – If the libSBML command encounters an error or the input value is None

Return type

str

Returns

Objective ID

genericModel(modelName, model_id, compXref, compartment_id, upper_flux_bound=999999, lower_flux_bound=0)¶

Generate a generic model

Since we will be using the same type of parameters for the RetroPath model, this function generates a libSBML model with parameters that will be mostly used

Parameters

  • modelName (str) – The given name of the model

  • model_id (str) – The id of the model

  • compXref (dict) – The model MIRIAM annotation

  • upper_flux_bound (float) – The upper flux bounds unit definitions default when adding new reaction (Default: 999999.0)

  • lower_flux_bound (float) – The lower flux bounds unit definitions default when adding new reaction (Defaul: 0.0)

Return type

None

Returns

None

species_id (str) – ID of the species to find

Paran ignoreReactions

list, List of all the reaction id’s to ignore

Return type

bool

Returns

True if its a product of a reaction False if not

outPathsDict(pathway_id='rp_pathway')¶

Function to return in a dictionary in the same format as the out_paths rp2paths file dictionary object

Example format returned: {‘rule_id’: ‘RR-01-503dbb54cf91-49-F’, ‘right’: {‘TARGET_0000000001’: 1}, ‘left’: {‘MNXM2’: 1, ‘MNXM376’: 1}, ‘pathway_id’: 1, ‘step’: 1, ‘sub_step’: 1, ‘transformation_id’: ‘TRS_0_0_17’}. Really used to complete the monocomponent reactions

Parameters

pathway_id (str) – The pathway ID (Default: rp_pathway)

Return type

dict

Returns

Dictionary of the pathway

setReactionConstraints(reaction_id, upper_bound, lower_bound, unit='mmol_per_gDW_per_hr', is_constant=True)¶

Set a given reaction’s upper and lower bounds

Sets the upper and lower bounds of a reaction. Note that if the numerical values passed are not recognised, new parameters are created for each of them

Parameters

  • reaction_id (str) – The id of the reaction

  • upper_bound (float) – Reaction upper bound

  • lower_bound (float) – Reaction lower bound

  • unit (str) – Unit to the bounds (Default: mmol_per_gDW_per_hr)

  • is_constant (bool) – Set if the reaction is constant

Return type

tuple or bool

Returns

bool if there is an error and tuple of the lower and upper bound
